intro: Claytonia acutifolia subsp. graminifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and visually appealing wildflower.
